bibl.title: Sterling P. White v. John Cody. Cost Bill
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p: Cost Bill in case of Ter. vs S.P. White J. W. Carpenter Justice of the Peace

To issuing warrant. 100
" committing to jail .50
" issuing subpoena .25
" 6 names appear in .60
" certain swearing witness 1.35
" Taking affidavit .25 $3.95

Witness Rogers 1 day transportation furnished in leiu of mileage 2.00
H. Porteh " 2.00
E. A Porteh " 2.00
R. C. Welch " 2.00
H. Beardon " 2.00
F. Beardon " 2.00
John Jump " 2.00
G. W. Sherman " 2.00
Wells Williams " 2.00
William Rohdes day guard from Dec 24th 1884 to Jan 5th 1885 both days inclusive 13 days @2.00 26.00
J. Friedlander night guard from Dec 24. 84 to Dec Jan 5th 1885 both days inclusive 13 days @2.00 26.00
A. J. Steigenwold team used in conveying witness from residence to placs of trial and return in leiu of mileage 800
H. F. Warren team for conveying prisoner and guards to jail 25.00
C. T. Blackfan day guard for prisoner in conveying prisoner to jail 6 day @2.00 12.00 mileage 140 miles $26.00

J. Friedlander Deputy sheriff
one day attendace 3.00
serving subpoena on 9 persons 3.60
mileage serving subpoenas 38 miles 3.80
calling 9 witness .90
going and returning to place of Justice 28 miles 2.80
For committing prisoner to jail 1.00
guardin & conveying prisoner to jail day 2.00
mileage " " " " 140 mile 14.00
I hereby certify that the above is a correct and true account and that none of the above has been paid
Witness my hand this 5th day of Jan. 1885

J. W. Carpenter
Justice of the peace

Cost Bill in the case
of
Territory of Washington
vs.
S. P. White

Filed Mch. 5th 1885
Kate W. Feuerbach
Clerk
